channel.title: Quick Question about JAR'ing
channel.description: Well, I got my client almost 100% Jarred. Only problem is, when it starts up it keeps trying to dl the cache. Anyone know why this is happening? I just want it to load up like normal.

item.title: Quick Question about JAR'ing
item.dc:creator: @runescapepkserver runescapepkserver
item.description:
@runescapepkserver wrote:

Where would I put the cache and images? And is it only the cache and images or the rest of the folders in my client aswell? Thanks for sticking with me.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 03, 2009, 11:48:15 pm[/size][hr]Lol, 15views and only one person decided to help, if you guys don’t know how to JAR then you shouldn’t even click on a topic about JAR’ing.

Read full topic

item.title: Quick Question about JAR'ing
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

The .jar cannot have the cache and images or such stored in it. Only the .class files.

Read full topic

item.title: Quick Question about JAR'ing
item.dc:creator: @runescapepkserver runescapepkserver
item.description:
@runescapepkserver wrote:

Alright. Let’s break this down.
OUTPUT DIRECTORY: A Blank Folder on my Desktop.
INPUT DIRECTORY: My entire Client
OUTPUT JAR FILE: Run Client.bat
Created the JAR, it’s a .bat file that 27.2MB… I run it then, a CMD Prompt comes up, too quick to read what’s in it. Hopefully this will help you help me a little bit, for whoever it may concern.

Read full topic

item.title: Quick Question about JAR'ing
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

A client that has been jared. Still needs to be in the same files a .class file would be. That is, unless you make a downloader and stuff for it. Basically, just keep it with the other files like the .class files would be, and you shouldnt have that problem

Read full topic
